full_text: The logged in user is a producer, Archie Armstrong. We will use a personal submission to give an overview of the underwriting issue process. One driver, John Newton, is 20 years old. Reckless Newton is an excluded driver as shown on the Rolls tab. The cost for the new vehicle is $200,000. Try to quote. The underwriting rule framework checks the policy data and raises underwriting issues that might block the transaction at certain points. In this example, the excluded driver underwriting issue blocks quote for the current user. Go to the risk analysis page to see more details. PolicyCenter displays underwriting issues on the UW issues tab. The Approve button is grayed out for the issue excluded driver. Agent must request approval if he does not have sufficient authority to approve the issues. A UW activity is created and assigned to the underwriter on the job by default. The agent enters details of the activity and submits the request. Note the assigned underwriter and the submission number. Log out. Log in as the underwriter. Go to the same submission. Type in the submission number. Click the search icon. Under UW Review appears on the info bar of the submission. Go to the risk analysis page. Approve the underwriting issue for excluded driver. On the risk approval details page, set allow edit to yes, which means the approval is effective even if the policy transaction is edited and the same issue will not be raised again. Click OK to confirm. The submission can now proceed beyond the previously blocked point. Edit policy transaction. Click OK. Go to vehicles. Go to vehicles. The underwriter found the cost new value was entered with an extra zero. Let's fix it. Quote again. Go to risk analysis. Underwriting issues are automatically removed when the condition goes away. In this example, the issue for high value vehicle that blocks bind was removed. Underwriting issues can be reopened after they are approved or rejected. You can also view the details of the issue. The risk approval details screen displays a history for each underwriting issue. Open the view issues block and drop down. Select view all. Auto-approvable issues provide automatic approval if the user has the appropriate authority. For example, state of garaging and total premium over authority are auto-approved for the underwriter. The underwriter must release the lock to let the agent proceed. A UW activity is created and assigned to the initial referrer who requested the approval. Click release. This is the end of the underwriting authority of view demonstration.

segments.text: The logged in user is a producer, Archie Armstrong. We will use a personal submission to give an overview of the underwriting issue process. One driver, John Newton, is 20 years old. Reckless Newton is an excluded driver as shown on the Rolls tab. The cost for the new vehicle is $200,000. Try to quote.

The underwriting rule framework checks the policy data and raises underwriting issues that might block the transaction at certain points. In this example, the excluded driver underwriting issue blocks quote for the current user. Go to the risk analysis page to see more details.
PolicyCenter displays underwriting issues on the UW issues tab. The Approve button is grayed out for the issue excluded driver.
Agent must request approval if he does not have sufficient authority to approve the issues.
A UW activity is created and assigned to the underwriter on the job by default. The agent enters details of the activity and submits the request.
Note the assigned underwriter and the submission number.
Log out.
Log in as the underwriter.
Go to the same submission.
Type in the submission number. Click the search icon.
Under UW Review appears on the info bar of the submission. Go to the risk analysis page.
Approve the underwriting issue for excluded driver.
On the risk approval details page, set allow edit to yes, which means the approval is effective even if the policy transaction is edited and the same issue will not be raised again.
Click OK to confirm.
The submission can now proceed beyond the previously blocked point.
Edit policy transaction.
Click OK.
Go to vehicles.
Go to vehicles.
The underwriter found the cost new value was entered with an extra zero. Let's fix it.
Quote again.
Go to risk analysis.
Underwriting issues are automatically removed when the condition goes away. In this example, the issue for high value vehicle that blocks bind was removed.
Underwriting issues can be reopened after they are approved or rejected. You can also view the details of the issue.
The risk approval details screen displays a history for each underwriting issue.
Open the view issues block and drop down. Select view all.
Auto-approvable issues provide automatic approval if the user has the appropriate authority. For example, state of garaging and total premium over authority are auto-approved for the underwriter.
The underwriter must release the lock to let the agent proceed.
A UW activity is created and assigned to the initial referrer who requested the approval. Click release.
This is the end of the underwriting authority of view demonstration.
